title.narrative: 6. CHILD PROTECTION IN EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS AND RESPONSE

description.narrative: by 2022, Child Protection in emergency preparedness and response as per HAC, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable girls and boys, especially those at risk of or affected by violence, exploitation and abuse, are better protected in their families and communities by institutions mandated for child protection and the society in general.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: by 2022, Child Protection in emergency preparedness and response as per HAC

description.narrative: Despite ongoing security and political concerns, UNICEF developed rapid responses by supporting the Ministry of Social Welfare to address related challenges. UNICEF provided immediate technical and financial support to its partners to meet the critical needs of children and families.; UNICEF maintained high-level advocacy for the signature of the Handover Protocol. UNICEF&39;s support has been critical to the monitoring and reporting of grave violations against children.;137,524 children (78,146girls) - and their families - affected by emergencies were provided with child protection services in humanitarian emergencies and COVID-19 context, including psychosocial support, protection and access to reintegration opportunities. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022
